document.title: Health Education Standards of Learning for Virginia Public Schools

CE3B280874454EC38E5049A707310DE0.description:
Develop a plan to work collaboratively with peers, families, and community groups to
address community environmental health and safety issues.

FFF839D1D0944903AA4EC4682D93D0A9.description: Identify careers and professions associated with environmental health.

6F11990764334E738B765DBD24E99A36.description:
Identify resistance skills to avoid violence, gangs, weapons, alcohol, tobacco, and other
drugs.

817915A71DD849EC8DBF6DC44FFE94B9.description: Evaluate a plan to prevent or manage the effects of bullying and cyberbullying.

0BE5C984C9E342D981DEC3CFB1775A98.description: Practice ways to resolve conflict peacefully.

1B29369E962A4739AE264E078845DD02.description:
Practice ways to communicate personal boundaries for privacy, safety, and expression
of emotions and opinions.

9A2CA7698AC248A48C19217CAD5067D7.description: Ability to create a plan to manage stress.

3BF7AC5652854478847A6B272390ADBD.description: Ability to set and monitor a personal goal to address one area of growth.

4651B86C4096414F9289F73FC620BCEC.description:
Compile and promote personal, family, and community resources that can help oneself
and others with mental illnesses and challenges.

29A5FE906D3D40879723366B80F87E8B.description: Demonstrate ways to show respect for individual differences, opinions, and beliefs.

96EE83FC04C448A3B9EEB17FDB9138E5.description: Analyze the influence of media on issues related to body image.

5424CE06B5EB4B1A97B65561C2803FF9.description:
Demonstrate appropriate behaviors during lockdown, fire/evacuation, tornado,
earthquake, and other safety drills.

5B980025BC8D4E4FB88CA6D62B25DBAA.description:
Demonstrate basic first aid and emergency procedures for common injuries, including
sunburn, cuts, scrapes, and insect stings.

F1F06CE931624018B83E4092BEE404ED.description:
Develop a plan to remain injury-free, including avoiding risk-taking behaviors online
and in the community and using safety equipment.

5DBC42DE1379471F992332CF8DA4E6E7.description:
Identify mental and health professionals and explain their role in preventing the
use/abuse of prescription opioids and other drugs.

A61060A5606748128D231AF7B1B7D9EE.description:
Describe the dangers of opioids in the home and the community impact of the national
opioid epidemic.

E1AA191579CE4346B1BC94F731DF635B.description:
Describe the types of support available at school and in the community for substance
use disorders.

7ED9B2C29B754BA290B4494D5BD207DF.description:
Examine the changes in school and community policies and laws regarding
tobacco/nicotine-free environments.

30442150BE4148DE882EF8C91733C84E.description:
Describe where to access accurate information on the proper use of prescription,
nonprescription, and unregulated medications.

A30842B7ABAC404F8C882C4970C363E5.description:
Analyze the reliability of health product claims for physical activity, nutrition, sleep, or
other areas of personal health.

74C332FEAB144920AB040320C65A798B.description: Monitor personal progress toward physical activity, nutrition, and sleep goals.

65C1D5BF405D4941AE78C44F76809FAE.description: Identify strategies to reduce illness at home and at school.

A608EBDFB42D4E3683C850EC62CD2DAD.description: Promote strategies to prevent heart disease, cancer, and diabetes.

19ADD62821DB461FBE8E0D8B5FF5A12F.description: Promote the understanding of the impact of food allergies on individuals.

E6F19DB61E6C4ACDA0C5C685A90FEF19.description:
Create a one-day plan for meals, snacks, and beverages that includes the daily
recommended macronutrients.

5CDEC36169AB4155ABFA632949216DD8.description: Describe strategies to promote renal health.

3B8A1B64353E4451B887B0DBC6DAC977.description:
The student will develop personal strategies and skills for personal, social, and community
health.

BFE7071EA9034EDABA94223B8C3EFE65.description:
Create and monitor progress toward a personal goal, service learning, or group project
to protect the environment.

DE75B3A67AEE4C0F94A317883A341145.description:
Explain the role of the Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) and local agencies in
protecting the environment.

7E9960322AF6430E86B0ED09D92D7A22.description: Explain the importance of friends or adult mentors in avoiding gang involvement.

F2DD6122951649BE9D78DC30A17A2637.description:
Recognize the role of family, peers, community, and the media in preventing bullying
and cyberbullying.

D9B113ED819A43669562E9FDBF1D717F.description: Explain methods to reduce violence and peacefully resolve conflict.

0E8481A2430D4D6494A35DCC6F787626.description:
Identify ways to set and communicate personal boundaries and how to respect the
boundaries of others.

66CA8ABF34134566BFB479BEE86B4439.description:
Analyze internal factors, such as responses to criticism or stress, which influence
emotional and social health.

6C8B79EF02CF47C29984B4BDEF45BB7F.description: Describe strategies to work through adversity and challenges.

6CA0D49DCD53481CA8049CF22632C0BC.description: Identify protective and risk factors for mental illnesses and challenges.

2E370867598548A1ABE64CC984DC3765.description: Explain the importance of understanding the feelings and perspectives of others.

FCAD03F648C74C23AA9645B24689C800.description:
Describe how culture, media, and other external factors influence perceptions about
body image.

55CD00A9BA1340F48317397E9CBB4041.description: Describe the consequences of not following school safety drill procedures.

5E4639F3000C453BBCFE1AD1DDA71F9C.description: Use a decision-making process to determine when medical assistance is needed.

EE9015ADAECD4A508626D54204CCE0AB.description: Explain the importance of accepting responsibility for personal actions to avoid risktaking behaviors and injury.

F374A7DA33444959A847317601304CF9.description:
Analyze family and peer pressure as influences on the use and nonuse of opioids,
alcohol, tobacco, inhalants, and other drugs.

E068710CF9B24BC69E5A1004C3A33C91.description: Differentiate between legal and illegal drugs that fall into the opioid category.

F79F11C4FC50479DBF94F7971E926578.description: Describe characteristics of substance use disorder.

7765B07D1C7B47E7A71C1308D5420674.description: Identify the benefits of a smoke and tobacco/nicotine-free environment.

AE7CDD266CDF45379FD7FD1ECCB87ED4.description:
Evaluate the influence of media and marketing techniques on prescription,
nonprescription, and unregulated medication choices.

DC248D45F06A46E0998B4EBB5EF7C313.description:
Analyze a variety of media to identify tactics used to persuade consumers regarding
physical activity, nutrition, sleep, or other areas of personal health products.

C44A02ABC0834AA8ABB0808962D88FB2.description:
Explain the impact of external influences (e.g., family, peers, screen time, social media)
on personal health choices.

8BAE701990754F239AC801DA170D4907.description: Describe the impact of immunizations and vaccines on individuals and others.

B2AB1B5DF33F4B6FA9A31999DAF1DF1C.description: Identify strategies to prevent heart disease, cancer, and diabetes.

B91C7E6172E84707B16032A4107C1986.description:
Interpret information on a food label to identify a food product that may cause an
allergic reaction.

CBA203A477544A9486A3472D7F887399.description:
Analyze the benefits of following recommended daily allowances for macronutrients
when selecting beverages and planning meals and snacks.

C6A24DA1A2544AA0AF4A437B813C2EF8.description: Describe the importance of proper hydration to support renal function.

0A3FF9C7C0D74A8F910997C63D6D9EB3.description:
The student will describe the influence of family, peers, and media on personal health
decisions.

816A4AD9BDFD4EA19C331CD1977C150B.description:
Recognize that all individuals have a responsibility to protect and preserve the
environment.

827AEC0DD47845FD9CA715E88FAFF5DF.description: Assess environmental health and safety issues in the community.

CD1AFD9BF287428685FC4548CB430577.description: Explain what a gang is and identify gang-related behaviors.

A4814E31474F42A199BEF44C70A11182.description:
Describe the possible effects of bullying and cyberbullying, including the increased risk
for harm and violence when bullying aggression persists.

15181B83462740978676380A404964AE.description: Analyze the role of emotions and media influences on conflict and violence.

C63DF35A153248FE9115E6B047E7F6B7.description:
Explain the importance of personal boundaries for physical, emotional, and social
health.

9D205BE8C39B42739399B02438DCA6E3.description: Identify potential positive and negative responses to stress and criticism.

60A79D744DDB449D8E2CEEBF5C0345E1.description: Describe personal strengths and areas for growth.

EEE95555763340739BA580D275F165DF.description: Define mental health and describe what it means to be mentally healthy.

DEDEACC32D6C41BF8A10536456B5611B.description:
Analyze factors that contribute to group success (e.g., respecting individual differences
and opinions, accepting responsibility, contributing positively, knowing when to lead and when to follow, dealing with conflict, using effective face-to-face and online
communication skills).

C0B02DE79A7644BE862D5F9901F34E79.description: Define body image and explain the importance of having a positive body image.

26426F5227F6485397268FBFB2FED705.description: List types and purposes of school safety drills.

76B5A015E1AC449397AB16A9A5D72950.description:
Describe basic first aid and emergency procedures for common injuries, including
sunburn, cuts, scrapes, and insect stings.

4C70A7EB6C484707A1CE0781F731278D.description:
Identify strategies to prevent injuries, including safety habits in vehicles, on the
Internet, in public areas, and during recreational activities.

27D710E7C5A9448882708F0C9D970F7C.description: Explain the importance of accepting responsibility for personal actions to avoid risktaking behaviors related to substance use.

DED5DC5310534236BAF897EEE55555BF.description: Define addiction and substance use disorder.

8CE2E288B5D2432995ABCC7FB6F887F2.description:
Recognize social influences/influencers on both the reduction and promotion of the use
of alcohol, tobacco, nicotine products, and other drugs.

CE2236D7CE094280BE10E8A96DED2B72.description:
Differentiate between proper use and misuse of prescription and nonprescription
medications.

0CEDDC4B6110452C91889B83BB3925E6.description: Describe persuasive tactics used by various types of media.

7B65539958B94E2987BBB3DDBDAC6177.description:
Identify influences (e.g., family, peers, culture, screen time, media) on personal health
choices.

820567BE3612409B9CB38C12BA7A752E.description:
Identify a variety of immunizations and vaccines available to prevent communicable
disease and illness.

CEB743F3CF7243F5B8195265CB943E5E.description: Describe causes of heart disease, cancer, and diabetes.

4C294CD35809450E81B4136F1D39EFA0.description: Explain ingredients in foods that may cause an allergic reaction.

AEC5007A54EB4922B9E6D6C3334CA707.description:
Compare the Recommended Daily Allowance (RDA) of macronutrients (i.e.,
carbohydrates, fat, protein) for adolescent males and females.

364E8445DADE4AB38EAE0EE9FFEC555A.description:
Identify and describe the major structures and functions of the renal and urinary
systems (kidneys, ureters, bladder, and urethra).

18283E905950489BB355172ADA6BA9EC.description:
The student will apply critical thinking skills and personal management strategies to
address issues and concerns related to personal health and wellness.
